Project Overview



Welcome to your digital project story!

We care about you and your organizational needs and requirements, we therefore took some time to learn more about YOU.


Here is what we know...

Situated in Rosebank South Africa, SimSciex has an unwavering commitment of excellence. Their track record and in-house team of professionals, stands as testament to their rich portfolio and achievements.


A heart felt true example of the phrase: 'A Picture can paint a thousand words...'

By scribbling their ideas on a piece of paper, a group of friends founded and established SimSciex Technologies in 2014, now a leading provider of cutting-edge technologies and services.


With a fast-growing market and ever evolving technology, one of the most essential requirements for success, is the ability to provide scalable solutions to companies of all sizes.

SimSciex knows just how to provide solutions and services that extends beyond customer requirements as they strive to enhance the every day experiences of their clients.


The dedicated and motivated team of engineers, programmers, designers and marketers, will work relentlessly to provide your business with the best fitted solutions for your company. Their friendly team of professionals will know exactly what solution will work best, as they dont only hear, but rather listens and understand the requirements and specifications of their clients' needs.


This organization also prides itself on fostering the potential of youth in South Africa through education and learning.

Quote: "Empowering tomorrow's innovators today - the Digital Futures Fellowship is not just about shaping careers, but about shaping the future of technology, creativity, and society." SIMSCIEX


From humble beginnings to an innovating leader, the inspiring story, a must see!


SimSiciex's has a wide range of Products & Services to suit every need.




Chapter 1: Changes

During 2024, the current means of communication gave way to a new service provider, a welcoming change.
A new era has begun...
A whole new world was discovered!

Some people would say that I have learned and developed into an expert in line with my duties and responsabilities.

I used my knowledge, experience and skills to provide people with well-educated guidance and training.

I consider myself fortunate to be a part of positive changes and organizational growth. I will forever be crateful for each employee, person and organization I had the opportunity to work with during this time.

This chapter in my story will always have a special place.




Chapter 2: Challenges

During my first introduction to coding, my love for endless possibilities kicked in!

Late 2022, an exceptional opportunity and challenge presented itself.
I said goodbye to communication, and somewhat stepped into development.

This was the start of a new chapter in my career…
I was eager to get started and just as excited to start learning all over again.

The first part of the year was focused on technical writing and systems training,
learning the do’s-and-don’ts and best practices to follow to achieve efficient results with the new tasks at hand.




The Next Chapters...

Each chapter makes a book... each module makes a system!

Once satisfied with my writing techniques and processes, I set out for a new challenge; training and software manual guides, conveniently available online.

This is where I started playing with coding again, designing and producing a set of possible outcomes to present our clients with.

Chapters was rebuilt to modules, and books complimented with online resources. The ideas are still flowing, and the next challenge is on the horizon.

The next chapters is still unknown, yet the posibilities promises to be endless.

The following sections will provide a high-level outline of your project plan.


Chapter 3:

Project Conception and Initiation



1. Project Purpose

  • This short paragraph describes the purpose of the project plan
  • It identifies the project plan
  • Outlines the desired outcome aimed to be achieved with this project
  • Core cncept: Provides meaning and ambition behind the project, providing focus and direction
  • Strategic Tool: clear project purpose helps in decision-making by aligning actions with the overeall objective.
  • Benefit-driven: The purpose should articulate the expected benefits and positive impact the project will deliver.
  • Alignmenet with stakeholders, ensuring all team members and stakeholders are on the same page regarding project goals.

2. Solution Overview

  • 3CX IP PBX (Internet Protocol Private Branch Exchange), voice solution planned to be implememnted. The new phone system will route and manage calls within supply chain business units and dealership sectors through secure internet utilization.
  • The new 3CX voice solution will allow for, but is not limited to, the following features:
  • Call Forwarding
  • Call Queing
  • Autto Attendance
  • Reliable and Secure
  • Cost Saving
  • Integration with varius devices like IP phone and softphones
  • Accessable across different locations
  • Key aspects used for real-time voice communication includes:
  • VoIP - Voice over Internet Protocol
  • SIP - Session Initiation Protocol
  • Technology:
  • Voice data will be transmited as digital packets by leveraging the inernet protocal (IP).
  • This will allow for easier scalability and flexibility in the network setup.
  • Componants:
  • IP PBX server: The 3CX server will be the centrl unit that handles call management and routing.
  • SIP trunks: ICTGlobe will provide the virtual phone lines that will connect the IP PBX to the public telephone network.
  • 3CX Extensions: ICTGlobe will configure the user extensions that will be used to manage call groups and call flows effectively.
  • IP Phones: As per the set out solution proposal, SNOM handsets amd desk IP phones will be used for the majority of the planned solution, with the exception of a view Yealink devices.
  • Softphones: The 3CX softclients will be installed on user devices including computers and mobile phones, as and when required.

  • Technical Writing, Software Documentation

Chapter 4:

Key Performance Indicators

This section describes the key performance indicators used to measure the success of your IP PBX integration project with ICTGlobe.

  • Call Quality
  • Although this is one of the most basic KPIs for measuring the success of an IP PBX integration, it is in fact one of the most essential performance indicators.

  • Call Qulatity Measurments and Metrics:
  • Clarity, smoothness and interruptions of a call, regardless of the device, network or location.
  • Packett Loss
  • Jitter
  • Latency

  • The above meatrics were identified to indicate the success ratio of your IP PBX system over the internet, how well it integrates to other systems, and the effect it has on bandwith and performance.
  • Call Handling
  • Call Analytics
  • User Adoption
  • Security and Compliance
  • Innovation and Scalability

Chapter 5:

Implementation and Execution



Project Implementation Schedule

Phase 1: Preparation and Planning (1- 3 Weeks)

  • The IP PBX voice solution required wiht this project, involved several phases which concluded the voice solution implementation shcedule.
  • During ongoing weekly scheduled online meetings, onsite meetings and discussions with various stake holders the following project assumptions were made:
  • Needs Assessment:
  • Current and high risk stakeholder evaluations was made through various discussions and meetings. The focus of these communication strategies were to outline and determine the end user requirements, needs and desired feauters that should be aligned with current business operations in order to effectively execute daily business operations after implementation of the new IP PBX voice solution.
  • Vendor Selection:
  • ICTGlobe Management,herein refered to as the voice service provider and secondary IP provider, was selceted and apointed by the client to execute the agreed required tasks in order to provide a seemless service implementaion, as set out in point 2 of this section; Solution Oveview.
  • Network Evaluation:
  • Technical Writing, Software Documentation
  • Technical Writing, Software Functional Requirement Specifications
  • Development; HTML, CSS, JavaScipt, JQuery, React

Phase 2: System Configuration (1-7 weeks)

  • System Setup: Fortigate installations and BGP establishment; 26 September 2024.
  • Testing and Change: Network testing, voice nbound and outbound call routing confirmed; 13 October 2024.
  • Number Porting: The first porting process was initiated on 16 October 2024, and the last was completed on 28 Novemeber 2024.
  • Extension Setup: 3CX User extensions configuration was done in line with the installation scheduled and as per defined requirements observed during site visits and evaluations.
  • Call Flows: Unique call flow configurations was done based on each unique business units standards, requirements and operational funtional requirements.

Phase 3: Hardware Installation (1-7 weeks)

  • Device Selection: For this voice solutions a selection of SNOM phone devices and hardware was selected, puchused and configured.
  • Hardware Deployment: Part of the installation process involved the installation of IP phones at various locations and connecting them to the network. Some instances required network change control schedules and implementation in order to proceed installation.
  • Number Porting: The first porting process was initiated on 16 October 2024, and the last was completed on 28 Novemeber 2024.
  • Pre-Installation Testing and Troubleshooting: Pre-Installation testing requirements was identified and communicated, including various recomended troubleshooting methods.
  • Post-Installation Evaluations: For each business units' completed change implementation, installation evaluation team defined tasks was identified and done. In line wiht the technical onsite evaluation protocols, and per business unite, an authorized representative for each site confirmed these evaluationspoints to be correct and sufficiently implemented.

Phase 4: User Training and Deployment (1-7 weeks)

  • Device Selection: For this voice solutions a selection of SNOM phone devices and hardware was selected, puchused and configured.
  • Hardware Deployment: Part of the installation process involved the installation of IP phones at various locations and connecting them to the network. Some instances required network change control schedules and implementation in order to proceed installation.
  • Number Porting: The first porting process was initiated on 16 October 2024, and the last was completed on 28 Novemeber 2024.
  • Pre-Installation Testing and Troubleshooting: Pre-Installation testing requirements was identified and communicated, including various recomended troubleshooting methods.
  • Post-Installation Evaluations: For each business units' completed change implementation, installation evaluation team defined tasks was identified and done. In line wiht the technical onsite evaluation protocols, and per business unite, an authorized representative for each site confirmed these evaluationspoints to be correct and sufficiently implemented.

Phase 5: Ongoing Monitoring and Support (Ongoing)

  • Device Selection: For this voice solutions a selection of SNOM phone devices and hardware was selected, puchused and configured.
  • Hardware Deployment: Part of the installation process involved the installation of IP phones at various locations and connecting them to the network. Some instances required network change control schedules and implementation in order to proceed installation.
  • Number Porting: The first porting process was initiated on 16 October 2024, and the last was completed on 28 Novemeber 2024.
  • Pre-Installation Testing and Troubleshooting: Pre-Installation testing requirements was identified and communicated, including various recomended troubleshooting methods.
  • Post-Installation Evaluations: For each business units' completed change implementation, installation evaluation team defined tasks was identified and done. In line wiht the technical onsite evaluation protocols, and per business unite, an authorized representative for each site confirmed these evaluationspoints to be correct and sufficiently implemented.

Chapter 7:

Project SNAG List

The below list serves as a brief overview of issues reported and resolved, in order to achieve the expected goals and deliverables required for this project to be a success.

Reported Description
Telephony Phone issues reported, was mainly based on configuration change requests such as; name changes, extension updates and provisioning, rather than device failures.
Phone issues and current status of same, can be viewed from the below redirect button; 'Telephony'.
Call Handling Call handling errors reported, mostly involved user direct lines which did not work sufficiently.
The call handling issues and status of same, can be viewed from the below redirect button; 'Call Handling'.
User Extension Extension issues reported, although it does not sound major, can in fact have some major impact, especially with regards to calls to sales agents.
Our super support team assisted tiredlessly to have the extensions regrouped and sorted.
The extension problems reported, can be viewed from the below redirect button; 'Extensions'
Major Impact For both new and ongoing projects, regardless of type, it should always be acknowledged that there will be risks. Although definite and potential risks are identified during the project evaluation phase, there is never a set guarentee that ALL risks can be avoided.
Major issues reported after installtions, was the main focus of our supper technicians. With their experience and technical knowledge, most major issues reported was resolved in a timely manner.
Issues reported to have major impact on business units and, or users, can be viewed from the below redirect button; 'Major Impact'.
Other Any additional bugs, errors, problems or issues not listed within any of the above SNAG sections will be listed once identified.
Until such time, there will not be a button to redirect to that section.
